roleset.name: cause to be covered with fog
roleset.note: FOG-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fog' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 57 'weather phenomena' which is just plain wrong. (from fog.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: one example is enough
example.text: Though it's probably safe to assume that the majority of financial planners are honest and even reasonably competent, the fact remains that, as one wag puts it, ``anybody who [*T*-1] can fog a mirror'' can call himself a financial planner.

roleset.name: weather condition
roleset.note: FOGGY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-7. (from foggy.01-j)

role.descr: explicit location that is foggy (copular subject, not empty 'it')

example.name: arg1
example.text: In Beijing city , the sky is foggy .

example.name: Empty it! Do not tag!
example.text: Let me know if it's foggy in your neck of the woods.
example.arg: in your neck of the woods

roleset.name: poor mental clarity, understanding
roleset.note: FOGGY-J NOTES: Added by Julia (from foggy.02-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: If you are still foggy about Cloud Technology, don't feel too badly.
